review: For the $19.99 that these cost when they came out, they're pretty cool.  However, it doesn't screen mirror with other Android devices, only screen mirrors with the Fire HDX about 50% of the time, occasionally freezes and needs to be power cycled, and doesn't have HBO Go.  HBO Go is available on other Amazon devices, so it doesn't make sense that it's not on the Fire Stick.

author: Susanne D Clement

review: Overall, it's a really good product to watch Prime and Instant videos on, though it has a very annoying shortfall, at least in my home theater setup. Essentially it will not function when plugged into my LG 60" plasma screen's side HDMI ports UNLESS you plug in the power adapter. This is a real pain because there isnt a nearby power outlet and it just looks bad with that cord hanging off the wall. My solution is to keep it plugged into an HDMI switcher in the cabinet, though it has an impact on the wifi reception.Easy to rent movies and watch prime.A pain to listen to Amazon prime music because you have to setup playlists,etc from a web browserPretty good responsiveness and picture quality.Hard to beat from $19
